answers.answer: If you have any friends who could be your labor backup plan I'd vote for natural. Inducing tends to me a rougher labor especially if your body doesn't start to contract on its own.

I've been induced twice due to complications too and both times went smooth. I'm high risk also and I plan to ask my Dr to induce me if possible because im sorta in a similar situation where I wanna be able to have everything set up with babysitting and such. And I want to be able for my husband to be able to request time off work. Last time he wasn't able to and it was hard. Seems like in your situation it would be the best.  talk to your Dr about it too for some advice. Good luck
I don't  have friends to be a back up I'm not exactly very social lol. An I'm extremely pickie about who I leave my kids with.
That's a tough one, I have a friend in a very similar situation. Do whats best for you and the baby and what will be less stressful.

I agree whatever will give you less stress is what's best for you.I'm  extremely picky about who I leave my daughter with and this time am actually flying my sister in a week before my due date just so I have backup home with me.

question: This is my 4th baby 2 beautiful daughter's 10 an 5 an an handsome lil man who is 19 months. I  was induced with my oldest due to Preeclampsia 2 weeks early. My second  was natural super smooth labor. An I chose to be induced at 39 weeks with my son. Glad I did  cuz he had cord wrapped around his neck. But it was an awful labor an it hurt like hell. I've not had the best with being induced. The reason I'm Considering It this time is convenience. I'm an single mom the baby father an I are talking but we don't live together. An my dad works who I currently live with. An my aunt an my mom live an hour away. An I'm high risk cuz of too much fluid. So if I think I'm in labor I have to go straight to the hospital. So if I get induced I can plan babysitter ahead of time. But I'd really prefer natural labor. But the I risk not having a sitter in time. So wats ur opinion ladies? Induced or just wait?
title: induce an 39 weeks or just wait for natural?
